title: ST_Analyze_Agg
description: Compute the statistics of geometries for the input geometry
sql_example: |
  SELECT ST_Analyze_Agg(
    ST_GeomFromText('MULTIPOINT(1.1 101.1,2.1 102.1,3.1 103.1,4.1 104.1,5.1 105.1,6.1 106.1,7.1 107.1,8.1 108.1,9.1 109.1,10.1 110.1)')
  ) AS analyze
---

## Description

{{< meta description >}}

## Format

```sql
ST_Analyze_Agg (geom: geometry)
```

## Arguments

- **geom**: Input geometry or geography.

## SQL Example

````{python}
#| output: asis
import sedonadb

sd = sedonadb.connect()
sd.options.width = 80
sql = """
SELECT ST_Analyze_Agg(
    ST_GeomFromText('MULTIPOINT(1.1 101.1,2.1 102.1,3.1 103.1,4.1 104.1,5.1 105.1,6.1 106.1,7.1 107.1,8.1 108.1,9.1 109.1,10.1 110.1)')
) AS analyze
"""
print("```sql\n", sql.strip(), "\n```\n", sep="")
````

````{python}
sd.sql(sql).show()
````
